pageContext.title: In brief: WeWork lands in the Philippines
pageContext.content:
US co-working and office space provider WeWork has announced its entry to the Philippines. Its facility in Bonifacio Global City will officially open in December and accommodate 800 members across two floors.

The Philippines is WeWork’s fourth market in Southeast Asia, following Singapore, Indonesia, and Vietnam. The company, which has more than 6,000 members in the region, also plans to set up shop in Bangkok, Ho Chi Minh City, and Kuala Lumpur.

Source: Press release

seo.title: WeWork lands in the Philippines
seo.description: It’s the company’s fourth market in Southeast Asia.
